textos_fuente.text: Our Team - Mad River Distillers Think Globally, Distill Locally ™ Our Spirits All Spirits How-to Cocktail Videos Cocktail Recipes Cooking & Baking Recipes News / Blog News Blog Awards Photo Gallery Tasting Room & Tours Burlington Tasting Room Menus Waitsfield Tasting Room Distillery Tours Buy Purchase Wholesale Single Barrels Reservations About Contact Us Events Our Team Donation Requests Our Process The Mad River Valley Origin Our Team The Mad River Distillers Team John Egan Founder Maura Connolly Co-Founder & Director of Sales “We have a great team at Mad River, which makes the job really fun. I meet amazing people every day as I visit bars, rest aurants and liquor stores. " A graduate of Northeastern University in Boston—with a Bachelor's in Communications and a Master's in Public Administration—Maura brings her thoughtful energy and communication skills to her position as both Co-Founder and Director of Sales at Mad River Distillers. While managing the sales process across distribution states (both on and off premise), travel is often on the agenda. When not traveling for work or adventuring with family and friends in her free time, Maura enjoys cooking, yoga and riding her bike. Her personal mantra is to “live every day to the fullest,” and that’s just what she does. Favorite Cocktail? Boulevardier and a Sazerac with Mad River's Revolution Rye. Mimi Buttenheim President “There are not many true craft distilled whiskies in New England. Mad River Distillers has a commitment to producing all of our alcohol from scratc h and being transparent about the process . " Mimi joined the Mad River Distillers team in 2015. After graduating from Brown University with a Classics degree and earning a Certificate of Baking and Pastry Arts from the Culinary Institute of America at Greystone in California, Mimi held General Manager positions at a boutique Napa Valley Winery and at a craft vodka distillery. Her career in food, wine and spirts spans 20 years and crosses multiple coasts. As President, Mimi is involved in nearly every aspect of the business as she works closely with manufacturing, wholesale and retail teams to meet production and sales targets and to execute the vision of the founders. In her free time, you might find Mimi riding her horse and competing in the disciplines of eventing and dressage. In the winter, rather than ski or board down the mountain, she prefers an après-ski cocktail in the lounge. She’s an avid cook who appreciates good food, and the good company of her husband and dogs (as well as her daily pour over coffee!). Favorite Cocktail? Boulevardier with Mad River's Revolution Rye (with Cynar instead of Campari) Alex Hilton General Manager & Head Distiller “At its core, Mad River Distillers is a family of like-minded people who enjoy a good time and good company. " Alex was born and raised right in the Mad River Valley. Previously a carpenter, he's a true craftsman who appreciates the value of hands-on experience, whether in building homes and furniture or in crafting small batches of whiskey. He actually performed all the renovations on the old horse barn that is now the distillery! In his position as General Manager & Head Distiller, he oversees the distilling and production operations in both Warren and Waitsfield. When he's not distilling or handling production, he's working on his sawmill at home making lumber for one of his various projects around the area or even at home. He also enjoys getting outside to hike and bike with his family, listening to live music, and cooking delicious food. Favorite Cocktail? A Manhattan with Revolution Rye ! Brad Fellure Assistant Distiller “ I love Mad River Distillers commitment to making spirits from grain to glass, and sourcing as local as possible along the way." As Assistant Distiller, Brad is responsible for operating all distilling equipment during the weekend, along with preparing alcohol for production needs. A graduate of Perdue University, Brad previously worked at Hotel Tango Distillery in Indianapolis, but now calls Waitsfield his home. We're so glad Brad joined our team, bringing not only his great distillery experience, but his curiosity and self-reliance. When not at our distillery, you might find Brad enjoying a college sports game, attending a concert, or relaxing by the water. Favorite Cocktail? Rum 44 steel bottom. Mo Horan On-Premise Sales Manager for Massachusetts and Connecticut “I’m excited to return to the Mad River Distillers team, which is a brand based on authenticity and a sense of place . " Originally from South Boston, but now hailing from Quincy, Mo got her start in the beverage industry while bartending and as a bar manager, developing a love for craft cocktails and brands. She gained further beverage industry experience working with Fever Tree and Tanteo Tequila, where she honed her expertise in sales strategy, customer relations, and market penetration. Mo isn’t new to Mad River Distillers, who worked with us previously in 2017. We’re very excited to welcome her back to our leadership team! Funny, witty and adventurous, Mo's idea of a perfect day is spent on the beach relaxing, with a cocktail in hand. Favorite Cocktail? Vanilla Rum Strawberry Daiquiri ! Mike Connell New England Sales Representative “Mad River Distillers customer centric principles are very important to me. It allows them to stand above the competition in the spirits category. I enjoy exposing new people to our quality spirits. " With a lengthy Sales, Business Development and Sales Management background, Mike joins us as our New England Sales Representative, responsible for on- and off-premise sales, events and business development. With both a bachelor’s and masters degree in Business Administration, Mike’s strong customer-focused approach and business-building skills are invaluable in helping the Mad River Distillers brand stay true to its customer-centric values. Mike strives to add value to every customer, distributor, and consumer he interacts with to continue to elevate the Mad River Distillers brand above the competition. Currently living in Hopkington, Massachusetts, Mike likes to spend his time outdoors and with his kids. His ideal day is spent with family and friends at the beach listening to great music, enjoying a nice drink and grilled dinner, and watching a beautiful sunset by a fire. Favorite Cocktail? Manhattan with Revolution Rye Jay Needleman Sales Representative / Account Manager “Mad River Distillers is a lifestyle company. It's like the friend you want at your party that will arrive early and immediately pitch in to help setup without asking. My position allows me to meet a wide variety of people, from all walks of life, and teach them about a great product line." In his role as Sales Representative / Account Manager, Jay's focus is on meeting and educating. On any given day, he may meet with buyers or conduct a consumer tasting event, where he showcases our spirits and educates on the quality of our distilling process. Jay learned the ins and outs of business at a young age while helping with his family businesses. He later went on to business school and got into sales, but always followed the Golden Rule, "do unto others as you would have them do unto you." He strives to treat other peoples' money as his own, to ensure that the value of any investment is well understood. Jay's focus on being and seeing the good wherever possible, is well reflected in his character. He is social, passionate, easygoing, funny and thoughtful—all qualities that not only make for a great Sales Rep, but for a great father and partner to his family. Favorite Cocktail? A Daiquiri with Vanilla Rum, lime juice and simple syrup. Matt Serrano Brand Ambassador “I am beyond excited to be apart of such an iconic brand, and cant wait to contribute to its continued success.." The newest member of our team, Matt most recently worked for Split Spirits. Prior to that, he worked at WhistlePig Whiskey managing their Farm Stay program. With the role of Brand Ambassador, Matt's position at Mad River Distillers is multi-faceted. In addition to taking a leading role in our events (including at our Waitsfield Farmers Market), Matt is managing our Capitol Region accounts in New York, assisting with the on-premise program for restaurant accounts across Vermont, and bringing groups to our distillery for barrel sales. With his industry experience and multi-tasking strengths, we're very excited to have Matt join our team. Kyle Sjostrom Burlington Tasting Room Manager “Mad River prioritizes passion, creativity, quality, and curiosity. I'm encouraged to make drinks and guest experiences that reflect my core values: hospitality, education, and taste. " Originally from coastal Mississippi, Kyle brings 16 years of experience in the service industry to Mad River Distillers. He began his cocktailing career in New Orleans, LA, and has managed multiple bars and restaurants over the years. In his role as the Burlington Tasting Room Manager, Kyle serves the ever-important roles of spirit-educator, drink-slinger, guest-talker and product-mover. When not in the Tasting Room, Kyle loves to swim, sail and fish. He also enjoys a good game of Dungeons and Dragons with friends. Favorite Cocktail? Corn N Oil made with Px Rum, served over crushed ice. . Brianne Lucas Marketing & Communications “A great brand has a great story, great product, and great people—all of which you’ll find in spades at Mad River Distillers. " Strategic marketer and multi-tasking problem solver, Brianne has spent more than 16 years in marketing and account management, working on just about everything—print and digital ads, websites, video and radio production, packaging, direct marketing, social, and more. While Brianne’s client and industry experience is diverse, she has worked with a number of local brands throughout her career. The local, high quality product at Mad River Distillers is what drew her to this role, as well as her love of whiskey. She provides research and web support, develops content and graphics, promotes events… whatever is needed! When not at her computer typing away, Brianne is likely to be found at one of the many Vermont parks or trails, exploring with her son and husband. She loves to walk, bike, listen to podcasts, and sing (but mostly at home.) Favorite Cocktail? It's a tie between a Manhattan or Malena with Revolution Rye . About Mad River Distillers Mad River Distillers is a craft producer of whiskey, rum and brandy in the heart of Vermont’s Mad River Valley. The ingredients for the spirits are sourced regionally from non-GMO, fair trade and organic suppliers and the mashing, fermenting, distilling and aging occur on site at the distillery in Warren, Vermont. The current line includes two flagship whiskies and 3 limited release whiskey offerings, 2 cocktail rums and 3 aged rums, and an apple brandy. Mad River Distillers is available in New England, New York and California, as well as direct from the distillery at their their tasting rooms in Burlington and Waitsfield, Vermont. Our Locations Waitsfield Farmers Market, May-Oct Saturdays from 9am-1pm Mad River Green Waitsfield, VT 05673 (802) 496-6973 Burlington Tasting Room 137 St. Paul St. Burlington, VT 05401 802-489-5501 The Burlington Tasting Room is open for retail sales as well as sit down tastings and cocktail service. Walk-ins okay! Our hours: Sunday - Monday from 12pm-6pm Tuesday - Closed Wednesday - 12pm-6pm Thursday - Saturday from 12pm-8pm Waitsfield Tasting Room 89 Mad River Green Waitsfield, VT 05673 802-496-3165 https://www.madrivertaste.com/ The Mad River Taste Place is open Monday - Saturday 10 am - 6 pm. They carry our full line of products. Warren Distillery Distillery tours are by appointment only, and are available at 1 pm on Tuesday-Friday, and 3 pm on Saturdays. Please note we can seldom accommodate same-day tour requests. The visit is $15 per person and lasts approximately 45 minutes, including samples of our award-winning spirits. Please click here for reservations. Connect Careers EVENTS CALENDAR Join Our Newsletter Sign up and receive our seasonal Cocktail Guide, other recipes, facts about our spirits, team spotlights and more. Staff & Board of Directors - Diamond Head Theatre Skip to content Box Office: (808) 733-0274 | Business Office: (808) 733-0277 Facebook Instagram YouTube LinkedIn Email Search for: Shows & Tickets Buy Tickets Season Subscriptions Seat Map Show Archive Subscriber Login Donate Annual Giving Capital Campaign Producer’s Club Sponsorship ‘Ilima Awards Auditions Show Auditions Shooting Stars Classes Year-Round Classes Summer Musical Theatre Experience Shooting Stars Instructors Scholarships About Staff & Board of Directors Instructors Volunteer Rentals News Show Archive Your New Theatre Theatrical Arts Building Make a Gift Sponsor a Seat Photos News Capital Campaign Donors Contact BUY TICKETS Staff & Board of Directors Jacque Vaughn 2025-07-23T06:29:51-10:00 STAFF & BOARD OF DIRECTORS We bring the magic of theatre to all Trevor Tamashiro, Executive Director Trevor joined Diamond Head Theatre as Executive Director in April 2023. Born and raised in Hawaii, and a graduate of Punahou School, he brings nearly 20 years of experience in nonprofit executive leadership. Trevor started his journey in New York City working for Broadway Dance Center. Other positions include: Chief Advancement Officer of The Diller-Quaile School of Music; Deputy Director of Saratoga International Theater Institute; and Deputy/Program Director for The Drama League of New York. Trevor is a member of the Association of Fundraising Professionals and is a Certified Fund Raising Executive (CFRE). He holds a degree in Theatre Arts from University of Miami, a Master of Business Administration degree from Pace University, and a Master of Science degree in Nonprofit Management from Columbia University. John Rampage, Artistic Director John Rampage is a performer, actor, choreographer, and director who has served as Diamond Head Theatre’s Artistic Director since 1995. He is the creative mastermind behind all of the theatre’s productions and programs, overseeing the curation of two or more shows each season and selects directors, musical directors, and set designers. His relationship with the theatre began in 1975 where he performed as Tommy Gilas in the 1975 production of Music Man. In the 1980s, Rampage danced and sang his way across the U.S. and Europe and returned in 1991 as choreographer of Evita. More than 120 productions have been shared with the community under his oversight. A 47-time Po‘okela Award winner for excellence in the theatre, John is also the recipient of the Hawaii State Theatre Council 2006 Pierre Bowman Award. Vero Beach couple to open first whiskey distillery on Treasure Coast Why is the president of the Martin County teachers union calling a School Board decision "anti-teacher"? News Indian River Martin St. Lucie Sports Advertise Obits eNewspaper Legals WHATTODOIN772 Vero Beach couple to open first Treasure Coast distillery, use Florida native ingredients Laurie K. Blandford Treasure Coast Newspapers Ray and Mandy Hooker are so close to starting the first craft distillery on the Treasure Coast, they can taste it. The married couple, both from Vero Beach, has been talking about their new business since about 2015 and are just a city lease approval away from opening Indian River Distillery at the Vero Beach Regional Airport in January 2022. “I really like whiskey, and Mandy likes whiskey,” Ray Hooker said. “She likes bourbon, and I’m more of a scotch snob.” 21st Amendment: New distillery plans to open in downtown Vero Beach Hani Honey: First meadery opens in Martin County Looking for a free mini puzzle? Play the USA TODAY Quick Cross now. Sour Sea Cow: Brothers use local ingredients to make hard sour ciders in Fort Pierce Learning to distill Kentucky whiskey Ray, 42, a third-generation Vero Beach native, grew up in Sebastian and graduated from Sebastian River High School . He met Mandy, 43, at the former Long Branch Saloon in Vero Beach. They’ve homeschooled their 12-year-old son, Chandler, since kindergarten. They already owned Other Side Services , a pest control and landscaping business, when they decided to break into the distilling industry. They sold their business last December to go into their new business full-time. The couple noticed distilleries were becoming more popular nationally, but none were opening locally — only craft breweries. In 2016, they learned how to run a distillery at a weekend workshop in Kentucky. Since then, they’ve been researching and learning as much as they can to open their own local distillery. “I really wanted a business for us that we could do together, that would be long-term and that we could enjoy together and have fun,” Ray said. Vero Beach owns airport building The Hookers started looking for a location that’s big enough to house a distillery and still have room to grow. They found a 4,000-square-foot derelict building the city owns on the northeast corner of Aviation Boulevard and Airport Drive, across from the Mobil gas station. It was built in the 1970s, then turned into a strip mall, then slated for demolition in two years. Rather than destroy the building, the Hookers found it would be more cost-effective to renovate it into a warehouse with a tasting room on one end and a large production facility in the middle. The end unit, previously Tubby’s Famous All American Subs, would remain home to the Flat Dog Diner . The City Council this month approved amending the airport’s zoning to allow craft distilleries. The next step will be getting the city’s approval of a 10-year lease, which Ray hopes to get by Oct. 1, to stay on track to open the second week of January. The building will require some demolition, painting, electrical work and new equipment to become a distillery, he said. Using Florida natural ingredients Until the lease is approved, the Hookers are taking online classes through the Institute of Brewing and Distilling in London to learn more about all the different kinds of liquor and spirits they plan to make. Some of their products will be seasonal while others will always be available, such as their rum. While that ages after they open, they plan to sell other whiskeys under their newly trademarked brand, N.O.W., which stands for Not Our Whiskey. “We needed whiskey now, and good whiskey takes times,” Ray said, “so this is not our whiskey.” The more local the ingredients used in their liquors, he said, the smaller the batch. They plan to distribute in the future, but not immediately. For the distillery’s “Hibiscus City Gin,” they plan to use sour orange peel and hibiscus, both grown in Vero Beach, as well as local juniper, which is the main ingredient in gin and typically an alpine plant. “We’ve identified a native juniper that lives in Florida,” Ray said. “We’ve actually made gin out of things that we have in our yard.” He’s excited to try to make a spirit out of honey too. He plans to distill the mead after fermenting the honey. Mandy is a beekeeper and maintains medicinal plants in their three-acre yard, where they raise chickens and grow vegetables. “I come from a landscaping background,” Ray said. “I’m kind of a plant nerd.” Ray plans to use wild oranges from old groves — typically too sour to eat — to make a sour orange 'cello for a different take on a limoncello. The distillery will stick to spirits only, no beer or wine, but the Hookers are learning about cocktails from mixologists. “When I was growing up, a cocktail was Crown (Royal) and ginger ale,” Ray said. “But there are really amazing cocktails that we can make. The options are endless.” Next up: 21st Amendment Distillery The Hookers are just steps ahead of another craft distillery aiming to open next year in downtown Vero Beach. Jeff Palleschi, 51, is waiting for the City Council's final approval at its Sept. 21 meeting to change the zoning on the Ironside Press building’s property from commercial to light industrial to allow him to open 21st Amendment Distillery by late 2022. The distillery founders aren't rivals, but have a collaborative relationship, Ray said. They plan to go to Tampa together in October for the Sunshine Spirits Festival , the first craft distillery festival in the state via the newly founded Florida Craft Spirits Association . They attended the association’s first annual meeting in May together. Ray said there’s room for a few distilleries in Indian River County. “A rising tide is going to raise all the ships,” he said. “We have a monumental task of educating our community on what a craft distillery is. We have to teach people the difference between a distillery and a brewery and a meadery.” The Hookers aren't trying to compete with Jack Daniel’s, and plan to keep their distillery local. “I’m not wanting to dominate the entire world with our products, and I’m not wanting to dominate all of Florida or the southeastern U.S. with our products,” Ray said. “Somebody else is already doing that, and I want to do something different.” Florida trails California in licensed liquor distilleries Florida is behind the curve when it comes to craft distilleries, he said. The state has 62 licensed distilleries, with fewer than 50 currently producing, compared to over 200 in California, said Florida Craft Spirits Association President David Cohen. Florida's distilled spirits consumption is about 51.1 million gallons, second to California's 73.4 million gallons, according to the Distilled Spirits Council of the United States . The number of Florida distilleries has doubled in the past five years, however, indicating an upward swing, Cohen said. The closest distilleries to the Treasure Coast appear to be Steel Tie Spirits Co. in West Palm Beach, Oceanside Distillery in Cape Canaveral and Honey Lane Distillery in Mims. Laurie K. Blandford is TCPalm's entertainment reporter and columnist dedicated to finding the best things to do on the Treasure Coast. Follow her on Twitter @TCPalmLaurie and Facebook @ TCPalmLaurie . Email her at laurie.blandford@tcpalm.com . Sign up for her What To Do in 772 weekly newsletter at profile.tcpalm.com/newsletters/manage. Photo courtesy of Ray Hooker +1 Facebook Twitter WhatsApp SMS Email Print Copy article link Save VERO BEACH ― Vero Beach natives Ray and Mandy Hooker recently received approval from the Vero Beach City Council and the Planning and Zoning Board to open a distillery on city-owned property near the airport. If all goes as planned, the Hookers expect to open Indian River Distillery the second week of January. The couple needed to jump through some hoops to get approval for the business, since there was no provision for distilleries in Vero Beach zoning. “There was no zoning in the city of Vero Beach or Indian River County at all that allowed distillation to happen,” Ray Hooker told Hometown News. “So we had to do a change of text amendment with the city of Vero Beach to add it in the airport light industrial zoning area. First we went in front of the planning and zoning board, and it was passed unanimously. They then kick it up to the city council, where our change of text amendment passed unanimously. So we’re good to go. Not one person objected, which I was really happy about.” According to a Planning Director Jason Jeffries, the Hookers needed to obtain approval for “a text amendment to Chapter 62, Article VII, Airport Master Plan Land Use Zones, to add craft distilleries to the ALl-1, Airport Light lndustrial-1 zoning district. The purpose of the text amendment is to allow facilities for the distilling of spirits and packaging of distilled spirits for distribution, retail or wholesale, on or off premise that produces less than 250,000 gallons per year in the ALl-1 zoning district. Adding this use to the ALl-1 zoning district will allow craft distilleries, a use compatible with the other commercial and light industrial uses in the zoning district.” “Currently, the craft distillery use is not permitted in the city,” Mr. Jeffries said in his memo recommending approval. “This industrial use is compatible with the other commercial and light industrial uses in the AU-1 zoning district.” To obtain the zoning change, the Hookers needed to pay about $3,000 in application fees. The Planning and Zoning Board conducted a public hearing on June 17, and voted 5-0 to recommend approval to the city council. Indian River Distillery will be located at 3212 to 3308 Aviation Blvd., on the corner of Airport Road and Aviation Blvd., in a metal building that was built on airport property in the 1970s. The building currently has one tenant, a restaurant that will remain in the location for now. The Hookers expect to use around 1,800 square feet for a tasting room, and 2,500 square feet for production. They hope to feature locally sourced ingredients as much as possible. “We want to do a lot of small batch things with ingredients that you can’t get anywhere else,” Mr. Hooker said. “As an example, I know a few people in town that have sugar cane that they grow. I’ll get a hold of as much things like that as I possibly can to do a limited run batch. So, for example, we can make a rum out of sugar cane grown right here in Vero Beach, or a whiskey from corn we get just west of town. Our products will highlight local history and local resources, instilling community pride in Vero Beach and Indian River County.” “We’re also using locally grown hibiscus for a gin, with the type of hibiscus that’s used in medicinal teas,” Mandy Hooker said. “Hibiscus gin is gaining popularity, and since Vero is the hibiscus city, we wanted to highlight that, another local ingredient and a tie to our community. We’re trying to be very Vero-centric and Florida-centric in everything that we do.” “We found that there is a native juniper in Florida that we can get for our gin,” Mr. Hooker said. “I called plant growers I know throughout Florida and found that Sebastian River Farm had some giant juniper plants, so we got from them three giant juniper plants so we’d have a good run of local juniper berries for our gin.” According to Mr. Hooker, the distillery will save the city money they would have otherwise used to demolish the building. “The city was planning on tearing the building down after the current tenant’s lease is up because the bathrooms are not ADA-compliant, and the city had determined it was most cost-effective to tear the building down rather than replacing seven individual bathrooms. Our uses don’t need seven individual bathrooms, since we’ll be using pretty much the entire building as one or two large spaces, so it’s going to be much more cost-effective for us to do it. Instead of the city tearing the building down, we’re going to lease it and renovate it. It’s a win-win; the city’s not going to have to spend money on demolishing the building and then leasing the empty lot.” “I’m a third generation native here,” Mr. Hooker said. “My grandfather was raised on a farm on the north end of John’s Island. My son was born here, Mandy was born here. We’re Florida people from way back. My family has been in Florida since the 1870s. I love Florida, our swamps, our marshes, our lakes, our woods. I want to keep a Florida theme on everything we do, just to educate people about what Florida is. People around the country think of the beach when they think of Florida, but Florida is a lot more than that.” While the couple declined to say how much they are investing in the business, Ray Hooker did say it is “everything we’ve got.” There are no other major investors, and they hope to eventually employ up to 15 people. Facebook Twitter WhatsApp SMS Email Print Copy article link Save +1 Vero Beach natives Ray and Mandy Hooker have received approval to locate their Indian River Distillery near the Vero Beach airport. Contact Us
– Fernie Distillers ${{amount}} Skip to content 0 Shop Now Cocktail Menu Gallery Tours About Us Our Story History Learn More Community Spirit Tastings Media Retailers Events Book your Event with us Events at the Distillery Cart ( 0 ) Home Limited Edition Year-round Spirits Tours Cocktail Menu About Us Wholesale Shop Now Gallery Contact tastingroom@ferniedistillers.com Facebook Instagram Age verification By clicking enter you are verifying that you are old enough to consume alcohol. Enter Our Story There are times in life when big decisions are made. Husband and wife team of Andrew Hayden and Jillian Rutherford took the plunge and established Fernie Distillers in 2016. Who We Are 1 2 Jillian, with her engineering background, is one of the few female distillers in Canada and is central to the operation. Combined with Andrew's experience working with global beverage alcohol brands and consumer packaged goods, they make a well-blended management team with all the necessary industry experience. The business draws inspiration from the community and its spirit and this extends to working relationships with other organizations, businesses and individuals in Fernie. Whatever it is, the way you tell your story online can make all the difference. Rich in History 1 2 We have a close relationship with our neighbours at Branch 36 of the Royal Canadian Legion. We are right next door. Sitting around the table with our friends at the Legion meat draw (every Saturday at 4pm), it was suggested that the hall become the home of the distillery. The rest is history . Found on 1st Ave, adjacent to Station Square in the heart of downtown Fernie, BC. Fernie Distillers lies in the centre of a resilient community that has survived numerous disasters only to recover and prosper. Fernie Distillers faces the railroad track where the original pioneering prospectors and miners disembarked ready to begin their new lives. Close your eyes and take a sip of one of our hand-crafted spirits, listen for the whistle of the train on the tracks and transport yourself back to those bygone days in our lounge. We have designed our space with you in mind. It has been renovated to be a welcoming and comfortable space unlike any other space in Fernie. Informal and yet refined at the same time, it is versatile and is available as a private event venue. Click here to inquire .  View the stills, chat with the distiller and learn about the process. Have a tasting of our current products. Relax in the lounge and enjoy a cocktail.  Our retail area has bottled spirits for sale as well as apparel and a selection of other unique items. Join the Distillers Roundtable Get the inside scoop from the team at Fernie Distillers. Email Subscribe *** FALL HOURS ***

Our Story | Dread River Distillery – Alabama’s Finest Whiskey About VISIT shop LOCATION EVENTS contact ABOUT Dread river Against the Grain Dread River symbolizes the chasm between us and where we wanted to go, the relentless torrent of issues and roadblocks, and the frigid fear of failure. In making this distillery a reality, we realized that overcoming our fears isn’t just something we did; it’s who we are. For us, DREAD is not a paralytic. It’s an inspiration, a challenge just waiting to be accepted. Our goal is to inspire our friends to face their fears with us. There's dread in all of us. Heart. soul. sustenance. Dr. Jeff Dugas and John Cubelic began the Dread River journey in the spring of 2017. Their initial business concept was a small craft whiskey distillery, which has since evolved to include a bar and tasting room serving the full line of Dread River products, a full-service kitchen, merchandise store, and 4,000 sq. foot event space. After two years of development and a jungle of red tape, the distillery opened in August 2019 with the goal of making genuinely excellent whiskey. Six months later, that goal was superseded by the global demand for sanitizer during the Covid-19 pandemic. Now, on the other side of that unexpected detour, Dread River is picking back up where it left off, creating products worthy of celebration. With years spent developing and growing into what we are now,  our mission has stayed the same. Dread River was founded to inspire you to share your stories -- overcome obstacles, live bravely, and drink deeply -- in the hopes that we can become a companion on your journey.  So, we offer you a glass. A toast to your accomplishments. Because we know your best stories are still yet to be written. DD6 9DX e: info@tayspirits.com t: (01382) 553880 m: 07794 693925 Send us an email Name Email Message Menu News Collections All Privacy Policy Delivery Return & Refund policy Billing Terms & Conditions Charity Requests Contact Us Contact info@tayspirits.com 01382 553880 facebook instagram linkedin tiktok twitter About Us At Tayport Distillery we create world-class premium spirits using the best fruit and grains responsibly sourced from local farms within 10 miles of the distillery. By doing so we reduce our carbon footprint and at the same time we can collect only the best ingredients to make great tasting spirits. The spent grains are recycled to produce gas for the local community and our used botanicals are composted for use in local community planting schemes. We are only a small distillery but have a big ethos to doing the best we can on sustainability. United Kingdom (GBP
